SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
App
The main application class for Socslingo.
BaseController
Base controller class providing common functionalities for all controllers in the application.
ControllerManager
Singleton class responsible for managing and instantiating controllers with their dependencies.
DatabaseController
Controller class responsible for managing the creation and setup of the application's database.
DatabaseManager
Singleton class responsible for managing database connections.
DateUtils
Utility class for date-related operations.
Flashcard
Represents a flashcard used in the Socslingo application.
FlashcardController
Controller class for managing flashcard-related interactions.
FlashcardDAO
Data Access Object (DAO) class for managing Flashcard entities in the database.
FlashcardDeckController
Controller class responsible for managing flashcard decks.
FlashcardListCell
Custom ListCell implementation for displaying Flashcard objects in a ListView.
FlashcardService
Service class responsible for managing flashcard-related operations.
LoginController
Controller class responsible for handling user interactions on the login screen.
PrimaryController
Controller class for managing the primary home screen interactions.
RegistrationController
Controller class responsible for handling user registration interactions.
SceneManager
Singleton class responsible for managing and switching between different scenes in the application.
SessionManager
Singleton class responsible for managing the current user session.
SidebarController
Controller class for managing the sidebar interactions.
StartupController
Controller class responsible for handling startup operations.
TransitionHelper
Helper class for managing scene transitions with animations.
User
Represents a user in the Socslingo application.
UserController
Controller class responsible for managing user-related operations.
UserDAO
Data Access Object (DAO) class for managing User entities in the database.
UserService
Service class responsible for managing user-related operations.
